title: Army discharge record
description: Russell's Army discharge record ("Enlisted Record and Report of Separation, Honorable Discharge," "WD AGO Form 53-55"), dated September 24, 1945. Russell enlisted in the Army on April 8, 1942 in New York, New York; and he separated from the Army on September 15, 1945 at Fort Dix in New Jersey, following the end of World War II. He was a corporal in the 857th Bombardment Squadron of the Army Air Forces, working as an airplane and engine mechanic. He received a European–African–Middle Eastern Campaign Medal and a Good Conduct Medal.
subject: Military service

title: Photograph of Russell in gas mask
description: Black-and-white photograph of Russell from the waist up, wearing an Army jacket and and gas mask. A handwritten note in blue ink on the top of the photo reads, "RUSS IN GAS MASK."
subject: Military service

title: United States Army jacket
description: Color photograph (taken 2021) of Russell's Army jacket, laid flat. On the right-hand side, there is a mechanics badge on the breast pocket flap. On the left-hand side, there are medals above the breast pocket. Both sleeves have his rank insignia, corporal.
subject: Military service

title: Letter from Russell to Estelle during WWII
description: Typewritten letter from Russell, stationed in the Army in England, to Estelle at home in Staten Island, New York, New York. It is dated May 13, 1945. In the letter, Russell details where he went in the United Kingdom with the U.S. Army from June 1943 until May 1945.
subject: Military service

title: Photograph of Russell on Army base
description: Black-and-white photograph of Russell from the shoulders up, wearing a leather jacket and aviator hat with goggles on his head. The text "1942" and "Russ" are handwritten in blue ink on the top border of the photo is and on the bottom border of the photo, respectively.
subject: Military service

title: Photograph of Russell wearing Army coat
description: Black-and-white photograph of Russell, wearing a long doublebreasted coat and Army hat. His hands are in his coat pockets.
subject: Military service

title: Photograph of Russell as a baby with mom and brother
description: Black-and-white photograph of Russell at three weeks old. He is wrapped in a blanket and held by his mother, Amelia Steinle neé Wizemann. Standing to his left is his older brother, Walter Steinle Jr., who is approximately four years old.
subject: Childhood & youth; Families

title: Baby spoon
description: Color photograph (taken 2021) of Russell's silver baby spoon. There is a letter "S" engraved into the end of the handle.
subject: Childhood & youth

title: Birth certificate
description: Russell's birth certificate. It was issued in 1946. It reads: "Department of Health / City of New York / Bureau of Vital Records and Statistics / Certification of Birth / THIS IS TO CERTIFY that according to Birth Record No. 4089 filed in the Bronx Office of this Bureau on April 5, 1921, Russell Logan Steinle was Born in the City of New York, on April 2, 1921. In witness whereof, the seal of the Department of Health of the City of New York has been affixed hereto this 17th day of September 1946." There are four signatures on the document.
subject: Childhood & youth

title: Photograph of Rusell as a child with brother
description: Black-and-white photograph of Russell (right), age 4 or 5, with his brother Walter Jr., age 8 or 9. They are standing outside of a building with siding, wearing coats and hats.
subject: Childhood & youth; Families

title: Photograph of Russell with parents and brother
description: Black-and-white photograph of Russell (left), age 8 or 9, on a boardwalk at the Jersey Shore, with his mother Amelia, brother Walter Jr., and father Walter Sr. The beach is behind them. Russell, his brother, and father are all wearing newsboy caps, shirts and ties, sweaters, short pants, high socks and shoes. His mother is wearing a brimmed hat, a coat over a knee-length dress, and high heeled ankle boots.
subject: Childhood & youth; Families

title: Photograph of Russell with parents, wife, and children on Easter
description: Black-and-white photograph of Russell (left) with his family outside on Easter. Seated from left to right is his step-father Theophilus DeCorte, mother Amelia, and wife Estelle. Standing in the middle is his daughter Barbara, aged 4. And seated on Estelle's lap is his son Rusell, aged 2.
subject: Families

title: Photograph of Russell in NYPD car
description: Black-and-white photograph of Russell wearing his police uniform, sitting in the driver's seat of an open-top NYPD Emergency Service Unit truck.
subject: Police

title: Police collage
description: Collage created by Russell. Background is a typewritten police record from March 1, 1953. Atop it is a black-and-white photo of Russell from the chest up, wearing his police jacket.
subject: Police

title: NYPD uniform hat
description: Russell's NYPD hat. Navy blue fabric with black shiny accents and brim. On the front of the hat is a metal crest of the NYPD with "5729" below it, also in metal.
subject: Police

title: NYPD uniform jacket
description: Russell's NYPD jacket. Navy fabric with gold-colored buttons and green lining. On the right-hand side, there is a NYPD patch on the upper arm, and a name tag that reads "STEINLE" above the breast pocket. On the left-hand side, there is a NYPD Emergency Service Unit patch on the upper arm, and Russell's assorted badges are above the breast pocket.
subject: Police

title: TWA crash newspaper clipping
description: Newspaper clipping of a black-and-white photo from The Staten Island Advance, dated December 16, 1960. The photo shows approximately four emergency workers, including Russell (front, second from right, with his back to the camera, and his shoulder obscuring the bottom of his face,) carrying a body on a stretcher at Miller Field in Staten Island, New York, following a mid-air collision of two airplanes near LaGuardia Airport. About four other people are standing in the background of the photo. The text above the photo is partially torn off, and reads "[...] of a TWA Constellation airliner at Milller Field after the worst air collision in the nation's [history]." The text below the photo reads, "The body of one of 44 victims aboard the TWA is carried from the scene." TWA Flight 266 crashed into Miller Field, while American Airlines Flight 826 crashed into the Park Slope neighborhood of Brooklyn, New York. In total, 134 people died in the crash, including several people on the ground in Park Slope.
subject: Police

title: Police retirement record
description: Half-sheet of paper cotaining a typewritten Order of Retirement from the NYPD, dated October 15, 1981. Russell joined the NYPD on September 21, 1946. His final day was November 11, 1981.
subject: Police

title: Wedding portrait
description: Black-and-white full-length wedding portrait of Russell and Estelle. Russell is wearing his Army uniform, and Estelle is wearing a white gown and veil, and she is holding a bouquet.
subject: Weddings; Spouses

title: Portrait of Russell in high school
description: Black-and-white high school portrait of Russell from the shoulders up, wearing a coat and tie.
subject: Childhood & youth; Schools

title: Photograph of Russell and Estelle dating
description: Black-and-white photograph of Russell with Estelle, smiling and standing in front of a car
subject: Childhood & youth; Spouses
